page.title: 08Agriculture in District
page.content: There are approx. 2500 acres of farm land in Horncliffe area, the land is mostly fertile good quality sandstone loam of Min. of Agriculture grade 2 and 3 category. Rising from the River Tweed to about 250 feet above sea level the gently undulating land faces slightly North. Most of the farms are owner occupied,and most of the work force are family members. In total no more than 10 hired men are employed, but some farm jobs are carried out by local agricultural contractors. With the reduction in the farm labour force many farm cottages are no longer required for staff,so some have been sold,and some are now let as furnished self_catering holiday homes. most farms are self sufficient,with a complete range of modern machinery,but a small amount of sharing for mutual benefit takes place.
